docs.snippet: Body-armored and gripping a high-powered rifle, former Sheriff's Capt. Clay Higgins looks at the camera and leaves no doubt what he thinks of the young men alleged to be members of a violent Louisiana gang called the Gremlins....

docs.snippet: From bug spray to armed security, fears of violence, economic unrest and the Zika virus have athletes and their loved ones taking precautions....
docs.lead_paragraph: From bug spray to armed security, fears of violence, economic unrest and the Zika virus have athletes and their loved ones taking precautions.
docs.abstract: Families of American swimmers headed to Rio de Janeiro for 2016 Olympics are trying balance pride and excitement with apprehension over reports of violent crime, economic turmoil and Zika virus outbreak in Brazil; some are adding special security precautions to their typical travel arrangements, while others have decided to remain lax.

headline.main: As New Olympians Celebrate Victory, Families Contemplate Safety

docs.snippet: The influence of black-owned media companies on black culture is diminishing. Companies are smaller and lack the financial resources to compete in the media landscape....
docs.lead_paragraph: The influence of black-owned media companies on black culture is diminishing. Companies are smaller and lack the financial resources to compete in the media landscape.
docs.abstract: Many black-owned media companies are fighting for survival and influence over black culture in changing media landscape; struggle is exemplified by sale of Johnson Publishing Co's Jet and Ebony magazines to private equity firm in Texas.

headline.main: Pillars of Black Media, Once Vibrant, Now Fighting for Survival
headline.print_headline: Pillars of Black Media Struggle to Stay Vibrant
